result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua A. Weiss

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joshua A. Weiss in court, in custody via video conferencing.  Attorney Joshua Ryan-Polczinski in court for Joshua A. Weiss.  Attorney Samuel Berg in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Ryan was just appointed and is requesting 45 days. Court will set this out further and if not resolved it will be set for trial. Motion to Modify bond can be filed. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendants Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joshua A. Weiss in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Larry R Pruden in court for Joshua A. Weiss.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Information filed. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver form filed.

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joshua A. Weiss in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Larry R Pruden in court for Joshua A. Weiss. State requests two weeks to file information. Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. Minutes filed.
Arraignment scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter in regards attorney/self representation/drug court

Defendant Joshua A. Weiss appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by JJ Crawford. Obi Uzowulu appears specially in person. Called @ 3:15 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for adjourned initial appearance. Record by Atty. Uzowulu that the Public Defender's office is still trying to appoint counsel on all matters. Asks for 30-45 days to get attorney appointed. Court sets matter out for appointment of counsel.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Joshua A. Weiss appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by DDA Sempf. Attorney MacKenzie Renner appears specially from Public Defender's Office. Called @ 3:18 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for Initial Appearance on 22CF322, status on 22CM83, and 8th status on 21CF196, 21CF367, 21CF557 with bail forfeitures tracking. Record by Atty. Renner as to the status of appointment of counsel. State is in compliance with victim's rights. Based upon record of Atty. Renner, Court sets out for a couple of weeks to see if counsel has been appointed. Court in recess.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
